sburjan - (08:52): is there an advanced mode in xwiki 2.3 stable ? I can see it in the documentation on the site, but cannot find it in the actual interface  
vmassol - (08:52): sburjan: yes there is  
vmassol - (08:52): go to your profile  
vmassol - (08:52): sburjan: then click the Preferencs tab  
sburjan - (08:53): I'm logged in as Admin, and I can't see this setting. Admin has this setting by default ?  
vmassol - (08:53): sburjan: you'll then see "USer Type"  
vmassol - (08:54): it's visible for everyone  
sburjan - (08:54): I'malready at advanced at User Type field  
sburjan - (08:54): I'm gonna create a simple user and try with that  
vmassol - (08:54): sburjan: Admin is advanced by default  
sburjan - (08:57): odd. created a new non-admin user  
sburjan - (08:57): and there is nothing in the User Type field  
sburjan - (08:57): and my objective is to activate de "advance editing" menu for an user

vmassol - (08:58): by default the field is not set  
vmassol - (08:58): in xwiki each field can be either not set or have a value  
vmassol - (08:58): not set in this case means that the user will be a simple user  
sburjan - (08:58): yes, but can I activate for my own account this option ?  
vmassol - (08:59): to change the user type simply click on the pencil icon  
vmassol - (08:59): (or click edit on the page)  
sburjan - (08:59): so simple users won't have access to Advanced Editing Menus ?  
vmassol - (08:59): sburjan: yes same as is described in the doc :)  
vmassol - (08:59): (I think the current doc is correct on this-  
vmassol - (08:59): )  
sburjan - (08:59): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HAdvancedMode

sburjan - (09:00): is this achievable ?

sburjan - (09:00): I can't find the option in the interface to activate it

sburjan - (09:04): let me switch to colibri

vmassol - (09:04): just tested  
vmassol - (09:04): so what's the not easy thing? You don't see the pencil icon?  
vmassol - (09:05): you don't see what it means?  
vmassol - (09:05): or is it because you see a button for password and would expect a button for the left options too?  
sburjan - (09:06): It's okay, I was a little bit of confused because I didn't see the pencil icon there  
sburjan - (09:06): yes, something like that. but abviously, the password button is much more important than the other, so it should be more visible

sburjan - (09:10): sorry for disturbing you :P

For example, in the comments section, should I put a screenshot from Colibri, and one from Toucan, or only one of them is enough ?

vmassol - (09:24): - use a since icon  
vmassol - (09:25): do you understand the since icon?  
sburjan - (09:26): hmm... nop  
vmassol - (09:26): it measn for ex when a new feature is introduced, it's documented in  section and we put a "Since XE 2.4" icon next to it  
sburjan - (09:26): ah  
sburjan - (09:26): I understand now  
vmassol - (09:26): so users can see  
vmassol - (09:26): if the feature exists for the version they're using  
vmassol - (09:26): someone needs to propose the details of how to do it  
vmassol - (09:26): maybe you could discuss it with silvia and make a proposal to the list  
vmassol - (09:27): in answer to this thread?

lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:27  
vmassol - (09:28): then once we all agree about the details we can document it somewhere on dev.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (09:29): another idea I had was to use the annotation feature  
vmassol - (09:30): but it has some drawbacks  
vmassol - (09:31): the best probably is to create a "since" macro  
vmassol - (09:31): that you would use like this: {{since version="2.4"/}}  
vmassol - (09:32): (or using the wysiwyg editor)

sburjan - (09:35): yes.

plunden joined #xwiki at 09:36

vmassol - (09:36): on these 2 domains

vmassol - (09:37): would that be ok with you?  
vmassol - (09:38): (you can talk to Silvia about it)  
sburjan - (09:38): yes, It would be okay. BUt an important aspect is that it must be correct from multiple pov's  
vmassol - (09:38): yes

sburjan - (09:39): or at least... 3 standard sizes

vmassol - (09:40): so we need rules to ensure consistency, look, etc  
vmassol - (09:40): but at the same time we shouldn't have too many  
vmassol - (09:40): lest people won't help on the doc part :)  
vmassol - (09:41): so we need to find the right balance  
sburjan - (09:41): yes ... but I think that if we create a solid "standard" others will be able to adapt very easily  
vmassol - (09:41): and focus on the most important stuff only  
vmassol - (09:41): yes

vmassol - (09:42): move it to a proper place  
sburjan - (09:42): because the documentation is pretty big already, and we need some general guides  
vmassol - (09:42): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/  
sburjan - (09:42): ah, okay

mflorea - (10:14): tmortagne: in a path-based multiwiki resources are shared, so for any subwiki, the WYSIWYG editor is loaded from http://server1/xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/ . When I make an AJAX request, it's URL is relative to the place where the JS code was downloaded, so the request goes to http://server1/xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/WikiService.gwtrpc . I have a servlet filter that catches this request and initializes the XWiki context. The detected wik  
tmortagne - (10:15): mflorea: no resources are not shared, it was a bug in older versions  
mflorea - (10:15): hmm  
tmortagne - (10:15): unless there is a place asking for resource without using URL factory  
tmortagne - (10:16): hmm wait  
tmortagne - (10:16): resources is different actually yes  
mflorea - (10:16): so what would be the correct URL instead of http://server1/xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/XWikiWysiwyg.js ?  
tmortagne - (10:16): since it's not about wiki  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:16): vmassol: Committed.  
tmortagne - (10:16): it's shared even in domain based multiwiki  
mflorea - (10:17): yes  
tmortagne - (10:17): but not when skin action is used  
tmortagne - (10:17): it's only for direct resources  
tmortagne - (10:18): anyway the point is that domain name multiwiki is never disabled  
vmassol - (10:18): jvelociter, tmortagne, everyone: we need to decide if we're ok to accept wiki macros in the default XE distribution  
tmortagne - (10:18): it's just overriden by path based when path based is provided  
vmassol - (10:18): (and where to put it in svn if we do)  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:18  
vmassol - (10:18): (and when we're ok to have a wiki macro and when it should be a java macro)  
jvelociter - (10:18): vmassol: what's the candidate ?  
tmortagne - (10:19): vmassol: maybe an example but i don't see the point of having real macro in XE as wiki macros  
vmassol - (10:19): a new contributor is going to be available to write macros  
tmortagne - (10:19): java macro are easier to unit test erc...  
vmassol - (10:19): we need to provide a list of macros  
jvelociter - (10:19): for me it's ok to have wiki macros. It probably will force us to fix the programming right  
vmassol - (10:19): we had started here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/NewMacros  
vmassol - (10:19): but we need to review it  
vmassol - (10:19): and to start with a wiki macro is easier to write than a java macro  
vmassol - (10:19): tmortagne: yes agreed so we need to decide if there's a use case for wiki macros  
vmassol - (10:20): ok I'll send a mail  
vmassol - (10:20): on the devs list  
jvelociter - (10:20): java macros are maybe easier to test, but sometimes it''s overkill  
sburjan - (10:20): vmassol : another thing I don't quite understand. Why the xwiki platform sees diffrently(as diffrent file names) two files with the same name, but capitalized extension. Example: image.PNG != image.png. On the web, shouldn't be any diffrence for a user ?  
jvelociter - (10:20): I would not write a java macro that outputs a complex XDOM  
jvelociter - (10:20): like a table with a lot of data  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:21  
vmassol - (10:22): sburjan: that's simply because xwiki is case-sensitive in general  
vmassol - (10:23): sburjan: it's the same reason why logging with "Admin" or "admin" is not the same thing too  
vmassol - (10:23): more generally speaking it's an inheritance from unix systems  
sburjan - (10:23): and you consider this as a good feature ? I mean, you want this ?  
vmassol - (10:23): well it's hard to change  
sburjan - (10:23): most of web sites aren't case sensitive (except password fields)  
jvelociter - (10:23): (for example I have a SVN macro that builds a table of data, a fisheye-light like - I would never have written it as a java macro)  
sburjan - (10:24): I see.. okay  
vmassol - (10:24): jvelociter: do you have a written example?  
vmassol - (10:24): because you loose a lot with wiki macros  
jvelociter - (10:24): I can try to find it, yes  
vmassol - (10:24): so I'm not sure it's overkill  
jvelociter - (10:25): you loose things but you gain other  
mflorea - (10:25): tmortagne: so what needs to be fixed? The WYSIWYG services don't need to have the XWiki content initialized for a specific wiki. When I need documents from a wiki I send the wiki names as a parameter to that service. So the XWiki context initialized for GWTRPC requests should always be the main wiki. In other works, the URL of the GWTRPC request doesn't have to contain information about the (sub)wiki.  
jvelociter - (10:25): it's a balance  
vmassol - (10:25): loose a lot = no IDE, no debugging, no easy automated test  
vmassol - (10:25): no easy rules too  
vmassol - (10:25): ie no easy checkstyle  
vmassol - (10:25): etc  
jvelociter - (10:25): yes but I don't need that for my macrio  
vmassol - (10:25): while it's fine for a user to do  
vmassol - (10:26): I'm less sure it's fine for a platform to provide it  
vmassol - (10:26): as a default macro  
jvelociter - (10:26): yes that's different  
jvelociter - (10:26): I agree with that  
jvelociter - (10:26): it will be easier to refuse to have wiki macros in platform once we have the stores  
vmassol - (10:27): sure but even without that  
jvelociter - (10:27): since we can say by default there are almost no macros at all :)  
vmassol - (10:27): it's easy to install a XAR  
vmassol - (10:27): yes  
jvelociter - (10:27): yes, but there's a big difference in discoverability  
vmassol - (10:29): jvelociter: I guess for wiki macros it depends if the macro is generic or application-specific  
vmassol - (10:29): for application-specific macros we could allow wiki macros  
jvelociter - (10:31): as a development practice, yes that could be nice  
jvelociter - (10:31): to have blog macros, etc  
vmassol - (10:31): mail sent
